Sentencas: Knudsen diffusion, an important form of gas transport in sub-micro/nanoscale porous electrodes of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), is evaluated typically based on the assumption of isotropic cross-sections of electrode pores.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As a consequence, errors are induced in the evaluation of gas transport and polarization loss of SOFCs with irregular, anisotropic pore morphology.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, a numerical model is derived to investigate the impact of pore morphology on Knudsen diffusivity and effective total diffusivity in porous SOFC electrodes.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Based on the model, the correlation between pore morphology and important parameters of SOFCs, including limiting current density (LCD) and concentration polarization (CP), is evaluated.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As the aspect ratio of pore cross-section increases, the gas diffusivity in SOFC electrodes decreases, and then nontrivial variations in LCD and CP are induced.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work facilitates the accurate evaluation of gas transport in SOFCs as well as the rational design of electrode microstructure of SOFCs.
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: (c) 2016 American Institute of Chemical Engineers AIChE J, 63: 2312-2317, 2017
Titulo: A critical look into effects of electrode pore morphology in solid oxide fuel cells
